snippet: Labor and liberal advocacy groups are fighting a potential sale of The Los Angeles Times and other newspapers to David H. Koch and his brother Charles G. Koch.
abstract: Effort by conservative billionaires David H Koch and Charles G Koch to take over Tribune Company, which owns Los Angeles Times and seven other newspapers, has set off firestorm of opposition in Los Angeles; public employee unions, leaders of California State Legislature and liberal advocacy groups are moving to block sale, denouncing it as threat to public workers and Democratic Party issues.

byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY and CHRISTINE HAUGHNEY

lead_paragraph: Labor and liberal advocacy groups are fighting a potential sale of The Los Angeles Times and other newspapers to David H. Koch and his brother Charles G. Koch.

headline.seo: A Bid to Thwart Los Angeles Times Sale to Kochs
headline.main: An Effort to Thwart Sale of Papers to the Kochs
headline.print_headline: An Effort To Thwart Sale of Papers To the Kochs
